plan: In the initial rounds, I'll test aggressive bids slightly above my value to gauge opponents' bidding patterns. I'll also try underbidding my value occasionally to see if I can win at a lower price. As patterns emerge, I'll adjust by using a mixed strategy: bidding close to my value when opponents seem aggressive, and slightly below when they appear conservative. I'll also experiment with random high bids to disrupt opponents' strategies and gather data. By round 10, I'll refine my approach based on observed trends, aiming to maximize profit by balancing aggressive and conservative bids.

For the next few rounds, I'll test a mix of aggressive and conservative strategies. Initially, I'll bid slightly above my value (e.g., value + 5) to see if small overbids secure wins without cutting profits. In mid-rounds, I'll experiment with underbidding (e.g., value - 5) to gauge opponents' aggression levels. Later, I'll try aggressive overbids (e.g., value + 10) to capture high-value items. I'll adjust based on opponents' patterns: if they consistently overbid, I'll underbid to conserve funds; if they underbid, I'll capitalize with marginal overbids. This adaptive approach aims to maximize long-term profit by learning opponents' behaviors.

To maximize long-term profit, I'll implement a dynamic bidding strategy. Initially, I'll bid slightly below my value to gauge competitors' aggression. In subsequent rounds, I'll adjust my bids based on observed patterns, occasionally placing higher bids to test their limits. I'll also explore aggressive bids when my value is high, to secure wins and gather data. When values are low, I'll bid conservatively to minimize losses. I'll analyze each round's outcomes to refine my approach, focusing on balancing risk with potential profit. This adaptive strategy aims to exploit opponents' tendencies and optimize my earnings over 15 rounds.
